title: Unable to compile inline assembly with an IntLike generic type

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
I am testing out the new [inline assembly](https://github.com/Amanieu/rfcs/blob/inline-asm/text/0000-inline-asm.md) in Rust nightly. I'm trying to run the RISC-V CSR read instruction, although the actual instruction doesn't matter. I'm unable to use generic data types with the inline assembly. I have defined the type as `IntLike` but I still get this error: ``` error: cannot use value of type `T` for inline assembly --> libraries/riscv-csr/src/csr.rs:39:57 | 39 | unsafe { asm!("csrr {rd}, {csr}", rd = out(reg) r, csr = in(reg) self.value) } | ^ | = note: only integers, floats, SIMD vectors, pointers and function pointers can be used as arguments for inline assembly error: aborting due to previous error ``` The structure that defines the data type looks like this ```rust pub struct ReadWriteRiscvCsr { value: usize, associated_register: PhantomData, associated_length: PhantomData, } ``` With the implementation looking like this ```rust impl ReadWriteRiscvCsr { ... #[cfg(all(target_arch = "riscv32", target_os = "none"))] #[inline] pub fn get(&self) -> T { let r: T; unsafe { asm!("csrr {rd}, {csr}", rd = out(reg) r, csr = in(reg) self.value) } r } ``` It makes sense that only certain types can be used with the inline assembly, but I would expect `IntLike` types to work. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.45.0-nightly (fe10f1a49 2020-06-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: fe10f1a49f5ca46e57261b95f46f519523f418fe commit-date: 2020-06-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.45.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ```
